about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?

about.name: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?

hasPart.assesses: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do? | You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

suggestedAnswer.text: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.

comment.text: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

comment.text: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

suggestedAnswer.text: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.

comment.text: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.

acceptedAnswer.text: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

comment.text: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

answerExplanation.text: Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

comment.text: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do? | Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?

hasPart.name: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should:

about.name: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should:

hasPart.assesses: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should: | To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To prevent hydroplaning, lower your speed in response to wet roads and keep your tires in good condition. If you detect a loss of control, take your foot off the gas, do not apply the brakes, maintain the direction of the vehicle, and allow the vehicle to slow to a manageable speed.

comment.text: Make abrupt turns.
Apply the brakes firmly.
Slow down.
Slow down.

answerExplanation.text: To prevent hydroplaning, lower your speed in response to wet roads and keep your tires in good condition. If you detect a loss of control, take your foot off the gas, do not apply the brakes, maintain the direction of the vehicle, and allow the vehicle to slow to a manageable speed.

comment.text: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should: | To prevent hydroplaning, lower your speed in response to wet roads and keep your tires in good condition. If you detect a loss of control, take your foot off the gas, do not apply the brakes, maintain the direction of the vehicle, and allow the vehicle to slow to a manageable speed.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should:

hasPart.name: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation?

about.name: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation?

hasPart.assesses: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation? | What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When traffic control signals are not working, a driver must always treat the intersection as an all-way stop and come to a complete stop, unless otherwise directed by law enforcement. The driver must then look and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

comment.text: Come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: If the intersection is clear, the driver does not need to stop.

comment.text: If the intersection is clear, the driver does not need to stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive quickly through the intersection to get out of the way of other vehicles.

comment.text: Drive quickly through the intersection to get out of the way of other vehicles.

acceptedAnswer.text: Come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

comment.text: Come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

answerExplanation.text: When traffic control signals are not working, a driver must always treat the intersection as an all-way stop and come to a complete stop, unless otherwise directed by law enforcement. The driver must then look and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

comment.text: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation? | When traffic control signals are not working, a driver must always treat the intersection as an all-way stop and come to a complete stop, unless otherwise directed by law enforcement. The driver must then look and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation?

hasPart.name: The speed limit at an uncontrolled railroad crossing is:

about.name: The speed limit at an uncontrolled railroad crossing is:

hasPart.assesses: The speed limit at an uncontrolled railroad crossing is: | The speed limit at an uncontrolled railroad crossing is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When you are within 100 feet of an uncontrolled railroad crossing where you cannot see the tracks for 400 feet in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph.

comment.text: 25 mph.
15 mph.
20 mph.
15 mph.

answerExplanation.text: When you are within 100 feet of an uncontrolled railroad crossing where you cannot see the tracks for 400 feet in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph.

comment.text: The speed limit at an uncontrolled railroad crossing is: | When you are within 100 feet of an uncontrolled railroad crossing where you cannot see the tracks for 400 feet in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: The speed limit at an uncontrolled railroad crossing is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body.

about.name: Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body.

hasPart.assesses: Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body. | Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body. -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Only the passage of time can remove alcohol and its impairing effects from the body.

comment.text: Drinking caffeine
Eating foods high in fat
Time
Time

answerExplanation.text: Only the passage of time can remove alcohol and its impairing effects from the body.

comment.text: Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body. | Only the passage of time can remove alcohol and its impairing effects from the body.

hasPart.name: What should you do when you see this sign?

about.name: What should you do when you see this sign?

hasPart.assesses: What should you do when you see this sign? | What should you do when you see this sign? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look for a train station ahead.

comment.text: Look for a train station ahead.
Signal before going any further.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and yield to trains.

comment.text: Slow down and yield to trains.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and yield to trains.

comment.text: Slow down and yield to trains.

answerExplanation.text: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

comment.text: What should you do when you see this sign? | A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: What should you do when you see this sign? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: What should you do when you see this sign?
